PC Number Date Chapter Bill Dept
 2022-08442022-06-28HC,  ,  ,  , 
ActFood and Drugs Act
SubjectRegulations Amending the Food and Drug Regulations (Nutrition Symbols, Other Labelling Provisions, Vitamin D and Hydrogenated Fats or Oils)
PrecisRegulations Amending the REGULATIONS AMENDING THE FOOD AND DRUG REGULATIONS (NUTRITION SYMBOLS, OTHER LABELLING PROVISIONS, VITAMIN D AND HYDROGENATED FATS OR OILS) in order to (1) require front-of-package labelling for most prepackaged products containing nutrients of public health concern, such as saturated fat, sugars and/or sodium, at or above specified thresholds; (2) repeal the table of nutrient content claims and incorporate it by reference into the regulations as a new Table of Permitted Nutrient Content Statements and Claims; (3) increase the required amount of vitamin D in certain foods; (4) ensure that certain definitions, food standards and other regulatory provisions within the regulations are consistent with the prohibition on the sale of foods that contain partially hydrogenated oils; (5) remove certain labelling requirements for foods containing the high-intensity sweeteners, such as aspartame, sucralose, acesulfame-potassium and neotame; and (6) amend the legibility and location requirements pertaining to the mandatory statement on foods containing aspartame.
RegistrationRegistration: SOR/ 2022-0168 Publication Date: 2022-07-20
AttachmentsAttachment
